title: 115_s2979
content: The Act may be cited as the "Spending Cuts to Expired and Unnecessary Programs Act" and includes a rescission of budget authority. The "Spending Cuts to Expired and Unnecessary Programs Act" includes immediate rescissions of unobligated balances totaling $291,854,263 from specific Treasury Appropriation Fund Symbols. The "Spending Cuts to Expired and Unnecessary Programs Act" permanently rescinded a total of $344,176,020 from various programs under different acts. The "Spending Cuts to Expired and Unnecessary Programs Act" rescinded $344,176,020 from various programs, including amounts from the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 and the Disaster Relief Appropriations Act of 2013. The "Spending Cuts to Expired and Unnecessary Programs Act" rescinded $344,176,020 from various programs, including amounts from the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 and the Disaster Relief Appropriations Act of 2013. Additionally, $50,000,000 from the Watershed and Flood Prevention Operations, $40,000,000 from the Rural Housing Service Rental Assistance Program, and $2,000,000 from the Rural Housing Service Rural Community Facilities Program Account were rescinded from the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2017. In the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2017 and prior Acts, various amounts totaling $64,391,258 are rescinded from different programs within the Department of Agriculture. In the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2017 and prior Acts, $37,000,000 from the Rural Water and Waste Disposal Program Account and $16,000,000 from the Land Acquisition program of the Department of Agriculture are rescinded. In the Consolidated Appropriations Act, $16,000,000 from the Land and Water Conservation Fund is permanently rescinded, along with other unobligated balances from various programs. In the Appropriations Act, funds for loan guarantees for renewable energy and efficient energy technologies are rescinded, along with unobligated balances from previous acts totaling $5,149,512,000. In the Appropriations Act, funds for loan guarantees for renewable energy and efficient energy technologies are rescinded, along with unobligated balances from previous acts totaling $5,149,512,000. Additionally, various amounts from different funds and balances are rescinded, including $800,000,000 from the Social Security Act, $1,865,000,000 from the Child Enrollment Contingency Fund, $220,000,000 from the Nonrecurring Expenses Fund, and $1,192,287 from the Department of Housing and Urban Development. In the Consolidated Appropriations Act, unobligated balances from the Department of Housing and Urban Development's Public Housing Capital Fund are rescinded, totaling $37,742,228. In the Department of Justice, unobligated balances from various funds are permanently rescinded, totaling $106,000,000. Additionally, unobligated balances from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act and Bilateral Economic Assistance funds are also rescinded. $30,000,000, $52,000,000, $252,000,000, and $85,938,251 are rescinded from various accounts in different Acts. In the Department of Transportation and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1998, $45,240,246 are rescinded. In the Department of Transportation and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001, $48,019,600 are permanently rescinded. In the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2010, $53,404,128 are rescinded from the Federal Railroad Administration. In the current chunk, $46,560,000 of unobligated balances for Transit Formula Grants from fiscal year 2005 and prior years are permanently rescinded. Additionally, $53,000,000 from the Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund and $22,787,358 from the Bank Enterprise Award Program are permanently rescinded. Furthermore, $53,404,128 are rescinded from the Capital Magnet Fund for fiscal year 2018. In fiscal year 2018, $141,716,839 are permanently rescinded under the Housing and Economic Recovery Act of 2008. Additionally, $150,000,000 from the National Service Trust and $132,612,397 from the Worker, Homeownership, and Business Assistance Act of 2009 are also permanently rescinded.
